UNITED NATIONS ( AP ) - Nearly 60 countries urged the U.N. Security Council on Monday to refer the war in Syria to the International Criminal Court for investigation of possible crimes against humanity and war crimes .

Syria is not a state party to the Rome statute that established the International Criminal Court so the only way it can be referred to The Hague , Netherlands - based tribunal is by the Security Council .
The council has previously referred conflicts in Darfur and Libya to the ICC .

Richard Dicker , director of international justice at Human Rights Watch , said the mobilization of countries far beyond the 15 Security Council members did n't happen when Darfur and Libya were referred to the court and is a welcome new development .
